_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:22:02 using v2.1
title: How does five-year cancer survival vary by gender?
analysis_commentary: Here, we have chosen only to include cancers which are present for both genders. For all but two cancers, the five-year survival estimates are higher for women compared to men by an average of 2.5%. Myeloma and bladder have higher survival estimates for men compared to women; this is a difference of 1.2% and 9.5% respectively.
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Cancer Survival in England
